text: I prepare thoroughly before entering negotiations instead of improvising on the spot.
I listen actively to understand the other party's needs instead of focusing only on my own goals.
I find win-win solutions that benefit both parties instead of pursuing only my interests.
I remain calm and composed under pressure during negotiations instead of becoming emotional.
I ask clarifying questions to understand the other party's position instead of making assumptions.
I can walk away from a deal if it doesn't meet my minimum requirements instead of accepting unfavorable terms.
I build rapport and trust with the other party before discussing terms instead of jumping straight to demands.
I use objective criteria and data to support my position instead of relying solely on emotions.
I can identify and address the other party's underlying concerns instead of focusing only on surface issues.
I make concessions strategically rather than giving in too quickly to avoid conflict.
I communicate my needs clearly and assertively instead of being vague or passive.
I can read body language and non-verbal cues during negotiations instead of missing important signals.
I maintain my boundaries and don't compromise on core values instead of agreeing to anything to close a deal.
I can think creatively to find alternative solutions when negotiations stall instead of getting stuck.
I follow through on commitments made during negotiations instead of changing terms afterward.
I can handle objections and resistance without becoming defensive instead of taking criticism personally.
I know my BATNA (Best Alternative To Negotiated Agreement) before starting negotiations instead of negotiating blindly.
I can adapt my negotiation style to different situations and personalities instead of using the same approach always.
I document agreements clearly to avoid misunderstandings instead of relying on verbal commitments alone.
I view negotiations as collaborative problem-solving rather than competitive battles instead of seeing the other party as an adversary.
